text: i am not someone that travel all the time but sometimes i do and when i do i sometimes have to use someone el laptop or other device it is usually at this point that all hell break loose and my account variably get suspended for a week a month etc or i have to register some sort of new phone number or email address which being somewhere else will not receive sm so i plead with you outlokhotmail please make your so called security measure more travel compatible and user friendly

text: i downloaded this earlier and when i went to log in it spent age connecting to my account at first i figured something must be wrong with the server i checked online and apparently this application is known for being notoriously slow one given solution was to clear the data i went to clear this application and realized this application is mb i do not know what is going on here but for an email application that is unacceptable and coupled with poor performance make this a logo
original_text: I downloaded this earlier and when I went to log in, it spent ages connecting to my account. At first, I figured something must be wrong with the servers. I checked online, and apparently this app is known for being notoriously slow. One given solution was to clear the data. I went to clear it and realized the app is 119MB! I don't know what's going on here but for an email app that's unacceptable, and coupled with poor performance makes this a no-go.

text: while synchronising email work there are a ton of issue synchronising contact especially from office account with fa enabled if i create a contact on my phone or update it it never flow to the exchange account but if i delete a contact that get deleted instantly from exchange change add modify delete made on exchange flow to the phone but can take anywhere from a couple of minute to an entire day manually resetting and resynching is not easy either
original_text: While synchronizing e-mail works, there are a TON of issues synchronizing CONTACTS. Especially from Office 365 accounts, with 2FA enabled. If I create a contact on my phone (or update it), it NEVER flows to the Exchange account. But, if I delete a contact, that gets deleted instantly from Exchange. Changes (add, modify, delete) made on Exchange flow to the phone but can take anywhere from a couple of minutes to an entire day. Manually resetting and resynching is not easy either.

text: give me the ability to have most of the same outlook function on my handheld that i have on my desktop but i have found two significant drawback if the internet connection is not speedy it is not able to get mail from the server i never had this issue when using my phone is native email client configured to pull from the exchange server and sometimes when a calendar event notification fire and i dismiss a calendar event notification fire a calendar event notification fire keep firing every minute after that getting quite annoying if these issue are not fixed i will likely revert to using the native email application on my phone
original_text: Gives me the ability to have most of the same Outlook functions on my handheld that I have on my desktop. But I've found two significant drawbacks: 1 - if the Internet connection is not speedy, it's not able to get mail from the server (I never had this issue when using my phone's native email client configured to pull from the Exchange server), and 2 - sometimes, when a calendar event notification fires and I dismiss it, it keeps firing every minute after that, getting quite annoying. If these issues aren't fixed, I'll likely revert to using the native email app on my phone.

original_text: Email functions are okay, if occasionally clunky.   The really  annoying thing is that none of the contact info talks with the other functions of the phone.  You can't look up a number that has been in your contact list for a decade with our using a pc.  That really limits a phone app's effectiveness.            Edit - okay, we found a way to fix that, but it took several back and forth emails.  Another drawback though - if you change  your password you don't have the option to login with the new one, you only get to look at your old stuff. It has an annoying habit of getting stuck "On" and running down the battery

text: sick of all sync failure time out removed my account installed outlook multiple time no good here is what finally worked for me i have a link router logged in and went to conectivityinternet setingsipvedituncheck ipv automatic enabled box ie it now is not enabled save the new setting let a link router reboot if it want boom solved at least for me
original_text: Sick of all sync failures, time outs. Removed my account. Reinstalled Outlook. Multiple times. No good. Here is what finally worked for me: I have a linksys router, logged in and went to: Connectivity>Internet Settings>IPv6>Edit>Uncheck IPv6 - Automatic Enabled [box] ie: It now is NOT enabled. Save the new settings. Let the router reboot if it wants. BOOM! SOLVED (at least for me)!!!

Minus one star since it's been "coming soon" for almost 2 years now.  Updated for 2018- Outlook has been an absolute godsend in managing both my personal and professional communications. text: outlook is determined insistence in updating mail continuously is a battery draining and data plan depleting problem unless you use a mobile fireball to block outlook and manually allow a mobile fireball when needed a mobile fireball check and download mail continuously no matter what you do on outlook or android setting a mobile fireball has a big appetite to keep an always active channel with m server otherwise a smooth and effective application has become a battery and data drainer gone back to mail offer manual check alongside auto
original_text: Outlook's determined insistence in updating emails continuosly is a battery draining & Data plan depleting problem. Unless you use a "Mobile Firewall" to block Outlook & manually allow it when needed, it checks & downloads emails continuously "no matter what you do on Outlook or Android settings." It has a big appetite to keep an always active channel with MS servers. Otherwise a smooth & effective app, has become a battery & Data drainer. Gone back to GMail, offers manual check alongside auto.

text: the last few update broke and have not repaired my issue i am on android droid turbo i have an hot-air account i do not see my new mail in my into i get an hot-air account and see an hot-air account in the top banner area i select an hot-air account to go to outlook and outlook open my new mail in my into are not there i tried clearing cache closing application uninstaling and installing and nothing work shutting off my phone and restarting doe not help while outlook is open i will get a notice new mail have arrived and while i am looking at my into a notice new mail do not show up i found out that if i disable wife a soon a grin take over take a few second my new mail in my into come in later in the day mail will come in fine while i am on wife outlook has worked flawlessly for me for the last year but the month or so sucked quick update i forgot to mention that when i instal and deinstall or just update it say the into need to download the message i will wait minute and it would not update the into is empty a soon a i turn off the wife the message pop right in so the issue with my setup is wife is unreliable vw grin work fine
original_text: The last few updates broke and have not repaired my issues.  I am on Android 7 Droid Turbo 2.  I have an Hotmail account. I do not see my new emails in my inbox.  I get the notification and see it in the top banner area.  I select it to go to Outlook and outlook opens.  The new emails are not there.  I tried clearing cache, closing app, uninstalling and reinstalling and nothing works (shutting off my phone and restarting does not help).  While Outlook is open I will get a notice new emails have arrived and while I am looking at my inbox, they do not show up.  I found out that if I disable WifI, as soon as 4G takes over (takes a few seconds), the new emails come in.   Later in the day, emails will come in fine while I am on WiFi. Outlook has worked flawlessly for me for the last 3 years but the month or so sucked.  Quick update:  I forgot to mention that when I uninstall and reinstall, or just update it says the inbox needs to download the messages.  I will wait 5- 10 minutes and it would not update.  The inbox is empty.  As soon as I turn off the WiFi, the messages pop right in.  So the issue with my setup is, wifi is unreliable.  VW 4G works fine.

text: look good feel good for the most part there are a few thing though that are a deal breaker for me i would like to keep the view a all account into at all time however when you get a notification and tap on the view outlook switch to only showing the into for that relative account you have to force the view to go back to all account having a whole line of screen space wasted on a filter button is annoying should have an option to hide for people who do not use the view even though swipe action are deletearchive delete doe not show up in the notification to action the view quickly if you want to delete you always have to open the email fully to delete
original_text: Looks good, feels good, for the most part. There are a few things though that are a deal breaker for me. 1) I'd like to keep the view as "All accounts - inbox" at all times, however when you get a notification and tap on it, Outlook switches to only showing the inbox for that relative account, you have to force it to go back to "All accounts". 2) Having a whole line of screen space wasted on a Filters button is annoying, should have an option to hide for people who don't use it. 3) Even though swipe actions are "Delete/Archive", Delete does not show up in the notification to action it quickly. If you want to delete, you always have to open the email fully to delete.

original_text: Avoid. I have spent two weeks trying to use this and have found that a great many defects make this app not worth the time. Examples of bugs are plentiful, but to name just a few: 1) Some new emails do not appear unless you close and reopen the app. 2) Pinch-zooming causes unexpected scrolling, rather than zooming in where you are pinching. 3) Some emails will appear as having been read even though they are unread, and vice versa. 4) There is no way to view calendar attachments.

text: my company has been using outlook since office and i have been using my company personally since the s when i was a msf employee i am disappointed by the integration with exchange it is kind of honey most of the functionality you need is there but the ability to select the period of online storage is absent and that is a big mistake also why oh why has outlook on mobile device never had the send a feature which outlook for pc has had forever in order for me to conduct my business using this application i have to have send a and make this application work with both premise exchange and exchange online what is so difficult since it is been part of office for nearly year very frustrating
original_text: My company has been using Outlook since Office 2010 and I've been using it personally since the 1990s (when I was a MSFT employee).  I am disappointed by the integration with Exchange. It's kind of hokey.  Most of the functionality you need is there, but the ability to select the period of offline storage is absent (and that's a big mistake).  Also, WHY, oh WHY, has Outlook on mobile devices NEVER had the 'Send As' feature which Outlook for PC has had FOREVER?????  In order for me to conduct my business using this app, I HAVE to have 'Send As' and make it work with both on-premises Exchange and Exchange Online.  What is so difficult, since it's been part of Office for nearly 20 years?????  Very frustrating.

text: my company us an outlook exchange account so for year i have used the outlook application and have enjoyed the outlook application i love that you can see your work email plus all your folder and your calendar in one application despite working for year my into and all my folder and my calendar have been completely blank for week a the outlook application tell me that the outlook application is singing this info i did the suggested reset account and send an email to myself fix and everything was still blank so i uninstaled and installed the outlook application and now i can not get past the first step add an account because an error has occurred time and time again what a joke application from a tech company
original_text: My company uses an Outlook Exchange account, so for years I've used the Outlook app and have enjoyed it. I love that you can see your work email (plus all your folders) and your calendar in one app! Despite working for years, my inbox and all my folders and my calendar have been completely blank for weeks as the app tells me that it's "syncing" this info. I did the suggested Reset Account and send an email to myself "fixes" and everything was still blank. So I uninstalled and reinstalled the Outlook app and now I can't get past the first step (add an account) because an "error has occurred" time and time again. What a joke app from a tech company.

original_text: The past 3 months, Outlook has been using as much battery power as my screen, cutting my battery life in half. After researching online, others suspect a phone contact sync issue, so I have changed the app settings to deny Outlook access to my phone contacts to see if it helps. Next, I'll uninstall. All other apps combined are only using a small % of the battery, and since I rarely use Outlook, it makes no sense - it's drawing more power than Android. If asked to choose, battery life wins.

text: exactly what i needed after the untimely death of goole into it has all the major feature of into including the ability to archive multiple mail at once which is still not in mail and is fast and efficient the only downside is that the mailbox doe not always refresh in the background and sometimes need to be manually refreshed by swiping down on the into other than that this is the best email client i have come across and this is free
original_text: Exactly what I needed, after the untimely death of Google Inbox! It has all the major features of Inbox (including the ability to archive multiple mails at once, which is still not in Gmail!), and is fast and efficient. The only downside is that the mailbox doesn't always refresh in the background, and sometimes needs to be manually refreshed by swiping down on the Inbox. Other than that, this is the best email client I've come across, and it's free!
